page.title: 04FARMING AROUND PENSBY
page.content: Around the outskirts of Pensby there are many fields.To the West of Pensby is mainly arable land and to the East is pasture land which is used for dairy and beef cattle. Arable land is to the west and vegetable crops such as lettuce, cabbage, potatoes, and spinage, as well as barley, are grown because the soil is sandy. Many machines such as the plough, seed sower, roller and irrigator are used. The produce goes to market in Liverpool. To the east the soil is a moist clay which is ideal for juicy grass for pasture land. Some of the grass is used for sileage. This is kept in a sileage pit and the cows eat it in the winter. After milking a tanker takes the milk to Swan Hill dairy. The farms keep cows, hens, sheep and dogs. They do not have much machinary.
